member.summary: Group of the setting. All settings within a config file are grouped by this.

member.summary: All config entries inside

member.summary: Create a list with all config entries inside of this config file.

member.summary: Create an array with all config entries inside of this config file. Should be only used for metadata purposes. If you want to access and modify an existing setting then use instead with no description.

member.summary: Full path to the config file. The file might not exist until a setting is added and changed, or is called.

member.name: P:BepInEx.Configuration.ConfigFile.SaveOnConfigSet
member.summary: If enabled, writes the config to disk every time a value is set. If disabled, you have to manually use or the changes will be lost!

member.summary: Reloads the config from disk. Unsaved changes are lost.

member.summary: Writes the config to disk.

member.summary: Access one of the existing settings. If the setting has not been added yet, null is returned. If the setting exists but has a different type than T, an exception is thrown. New settings should be added with .

member.param: Section and Key of the setting.

member.typeparam: Type of the value contained in this setting.

member.name: T:BepInEx.Configuration.KeyboardShortcut
member.summary:
A keyboard shortcut that can be used in Update method to check if user presses a key combo. The shortcut is only triggered when the user presses the exact combination. For example, F + LeftCtrl will trigger only if user presses and holds only LeftCtrl, and then presses F. If any other keys are pressed, the shortcut will not trigger.
Can be used as a value of a setting in to allow user to change this shortcut and have the changes saved.
How to use: Use in this class instead of in the Update loop.

member.name: F:BepInEx.Configuration.KeyboardShortcut.Empty
member.summary: Shortcut that never triggers.

member.name: F:BepInEx.Configuration.KeyboardShortcut.AllKeyCodes
member.summary: All KeyCode values that can be used in a keyboard shortcut.

member.name: M:BepInEx.Configuration.KeyboardShortcut.#ctor(UnityEngine.KeyCode,UnityEngine.KeyCode[])
member.summary: Create a new keyboard shortcut.
member.param: Main key to press
Keys that should be held down before main key is registered

member.name: P:BepInEx.Configuration.KeyboardShortcut.MainKey
member.summary: Main key of the key combination. It has to be pressed / let go last for the combination to be triggered. If the combination is empty, is returned.

member.name: P:BepInEx.Configuration.KeyboardShortcut.Modifiers
member.summary: Modifiers of the key combination, if any.

member.name: M:BepInEx.Configuration.KeyboardShortcut.Deserialize(System.String)
member.summary: Attempt to deserialize key combination from the string.

member.name: M:BepInEx.Configuration.KeyboardShortcut.Serialize
member.summary: Serialize the key combination into a user readable string.

member.name: M:BepInEx.Configuration.KeyboardShortcut.IsDown
member.summary: Check if the main key was just pressed (Input.GetKeyDown), and specified modifier keys are all pressed

member.name: M:BepInEx.Configuration.KeyboardShortcut.IsPressed
member.summary: Check if the main key is currently held down (Input.GetKey), and specified modifier keys are all pressed

member.name: M:BepInEx.Configuration.KeyboardShortcut.IsUp
member.summary: Check if the main key was just lifted (Input.GetKeyUp), and specified modifier keys are all pressed.

member.name: P:BepInEx.Configuration.TypeConverter.ConvertToString
member.summary: Used to serialize the type into a (hopefully) human-readable string. Object is the instance to serialize, Type is the object's type.

member.name: P:BepInEx.Configuration.TypeConverter.ConvertToObject
member.summary: Used to deserialize the type from a string. String is the data to deserialize, Type is the object's type, should return instance to an object of Type.

member.name: P:BepInEx.BepInPlugin.Version
member.summary: The specfic version of the plugin.

member.name: T:BepInEx.BepInDependency
member.summary: This attribute specifies any dependencies that this plugin has on other plugins.

member.summary: Flags that are applied to a dependency

member.name: F:BepInEx.BepInDependency.DependencyFlags.HardDependency
member.summary: The plugin has a hard dependency on the referenced plugin, and will not run without it.

member.name: F:BepInEx.BepInDependency.DependencyFlags.SoftDependency
member.summary: This plugin has a soft dependency on the referenced plugin, and is able to run without it.

member.name: P:BepInEx.BepInDependency.DependencyGUID
member.summary: The GUID of the referenced plugin.

member.name: P:BepInEx.BepInDependency.Flags
member.summary: The flags associated with this dependency definition.

member.name: P:BepInEx.BepInDependency.MinimumVersion
member.summary: The minimum version of the referenced plugin.

member.name: M:BepInEx.BepInDependency.#ctor(System.String,BepInEx.BepInDependency.DependencyFlags)
member.summary: Marks this as depenant on another plugin. The other plugin will be loaded before this one. If the other plugin doesn't exist, what happens depends on the parameter.
member.param: The GUID of the referenced plugin.
The flags associated with this dependency definition.

member.name: M:BepInEx.BepInDependency.#ctor(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Marks this as depenant on another plugin. The other plugin will be loaded before this one. If the other plugin doesn't exist or is of a version below , this plugin will not load and an error will be logged instead.
member.param: The GUID of the referenced plugin.
The minimum version of the referenced plugin.
member.remarks: When version is supplied the dependency is always treated as HardDependency

member.name: T:BepInEx.BepInIncompatibility

member.summary: The GUID of the referenced plugin.

member.name: M:BepInEx.BepInIncompatibility.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Marks this as incompatible with another plugin. If the other plugin exists, this plugin will not be loaded and a warning will be shown.
member.param: The GUID of the referenced plugin.

member.name: T:BepInEx.BuildInfoAttribute
member.summary: This class is appended to AssemblyInfo.cs when BepInEx is built via a CI pipeline. It is mainly intended to signify that the current build is not a release build and is special, like for instance a bleeding edge build.

The directory that the currently executing process resides in.
On OSX however, this is the parent directory of the game.app folder.

The path to the plugin folder which resides in the BepInEx folder.
This is ONLY guaranteed to be set correctly when Chainloader has been initialized.

member.name: T:BepInEx.ThreadingHelper
member.summary: Provides methods for running code on other threads and synchronizing with the main thread.

member.name: P:BepInEx.ThreadingHelper.Instance
member.summary: Current instance of the helper.

member.name: P:BepInEx.ThreadingHelper.SynchronizingObject
member.summary: Gives methods for invoking delegates on the main unity thread, both synchronously and asynchronously. Can be used in many built-in framework types, for example and to make their events fire on the main unity thread.

member.name: M:BepInEx.ThreadingHelper.StartSyncInvoke(System.Action)
member.summary: Queue the delegate to be invoked on the main unity thread. Use to synchronize your threads.

member.name: M:BepInEx.ThreadingHelper.StartAsyncInvoke(System.Func{System.Action})
member.summary: Queue the delegate to be invoked on a background thread. Use this to run slow tasks without affecting the game. NOTE: Most of Unity API can not be accessed while running on another thread!
member.param: Task to be executed on another thread. Can optionally return an Action that will be executed on the main thread. You can use this action to return results of your work safely. Return null if this is not needed.

member.name: P:BepInEx.ThreadingHelper.InvokeRequired
member.summary: False if current code is executing on the main unity thread, otherwise True. Warning: Will return true before the first frame finishes (i.e. inside plugin Awake and Start methods).

member.name: T:BepInEx.ThreadingExtensions
member.summary: Convenience extensions for utilizing multiple threads and using the .

member.name: M:BepInEx.ThreadingExtensions.RunParallel``2(System.Collections.Generic.IList{``0},System.Func{``0,``1},System.Int32)
member.summary: Apply a function to a collection of data by spreading the work on multiple threads. Outputs of the functions are returned to the current thread and yielded one by one.
member.typeparam: Type of the input values.
Type of the output values.
member.param: Input values for the work function.
Function to apply to the data on multiple threads at once.
Number of worker threads. By default SystemInfo.processorCount is used.
member.exception: An exception was thrown inside one of the threads, and the operation was aborted.

The value to return if parsing is unsuccessful.
member.returns: Boolean value of input if able to be parsed, otherwise default value.

member.summary: Indicates whether a specified string is null, empty, or consists only of white-space characters.

member.returns: True if the value parameter is null or empty, or if value consists exclusively of white-space characters.

member.name: M:BepInEx.Utility.TopologicalSort``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Func{``0,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0}})
member.summary: Sorts a given dependency graph using a direct toposort, reporting possible cyclic dependencies.
member.param: Nodes to sort
Function that maps a node to a collection of its dependencies.
member.typeparam: Type of the node in a dependency graph.
member.returns: Collection of nodes sorted in the order of least dependencies to the most.
member.exception: Thrown when a cyclic dependency occurs.

member.name: M:BepInEx.Utility.TryParseAssemblyName(System.String,System.Reflection.AssemblyName@)
member.summary: Try to parse given string as an assembly name
member.param: Fully qualified assembly name
Resulting instance
member.returns: true, if parsing was successful, otherwise false
member.remarks: On some versions of mono, using fails because it runs on unmanaged side which has problems with encoding. Using solves this by doing parsing on managed side instead.

member.returns: Collection of all files in the directories.
